titleStmt.title: The Norfolke gentleman his last vvill and testament: and how hee committed the keeping of his children to his owne brother, who dealt most wickedly with them: and how God plagued him for it. To the tune of Rogero.
Children in the wood (Ballad)

The Norfolke gentleman his last vvill and testament: and how hee committed the keeping of his children to his owne brother, who dealt most wickedly with them: and how God plagued him for it. To the tune of Rogero.
Children in the wood (Ballad)

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Now ponder well you parents deare ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by STC.
In this edition: line 1 of heading ends: Testament; line 2 of heading ends: brother.
In two parts, separated for mounting; woodcuts at head of each part.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
